section.section:
The purchase price may not be valued at a higher figure than the sum of:
the actual market value at the time of purchase; and
the actual brokerage, transfer, postage, or express charges paid in the acquisition of the bond or other evidence of indebtedness.

Unless otherwise provided by a valuation that the Commissioner establishes or approves, a bond or other evidence of indebtedness may not be carried on its books at above the call price for the entire issue during any period within which the security may be called.
